name: Trinity Test
details: The first detonation of a nuclear device, conducted by the United States as part of the Manhattan Project.

name: Hiroshima & Nagasaki
summary: Atomic bombings in Japan during WWII.
details: Atomic bombs were dropped by the US, killing over 200,000 people and causing long-term radiation effects.

name: Kyshtym Disaster
details: A failed storage tank led to a radioactive release. Covered up by Soviet authorities until decades later.

name: SL-1 Reactor Explosion
details: Three operators were killed when a control rod was removed too far, causing a steam explosion.

name: Baneberry Test
details: An underground nuclear test that unintentionally vented radioactive dust into the atmosphere.

name: Three Mile Island
details: A loss of coolant caused a partial meltdown, significantly affecting public opinion on nuclear power.

name: Chernobyl Disaster
details: The worst nuclear disaster in history. A reactor explosion released radioactive material across Europe.

name: GoiÃ¢nia Accident
details: A scavenged radiotherapy source caused widespread radiation poisoning and environmental contamination.

name: Tokaimura Criticality
details: Two workers died after mishandling uranium, causing a sustained nuclear chain reaction.

name: Fukushima Daiichi
details: A 9.0 earthquake and tsunami disabled power and cooling, resulting in core meltdowns and hydrogen explosions.
